result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel D Hughes

defendant.name: Hughes, Joel D
defendant.address: c/o Vilas County Jail, Eagle River, WI 54521

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM Defendant Joel D Hughes appeared by video, in custody Marathon County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Joel D Hughes.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. No victim present in court.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joel D Hughes in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared by video for County of Vilas. Attorney Svehlek in court.  There has been a settlement offer, but no resolution.  Final Pretrial/Plea hearing October 3, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Joel D Hughes in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by zoom video for Joel D Hughes.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared by zoom video for State of Wisconsin. Judge Sloma called all eleven cases this morning. Cases 22CF54, 21CF286 and 21CF399 were set for arraignment today. All other cases are tracking. Informations on file.  Attorney Svehlek enters not guilty pleas. Court accepts pleas and sets Pretrial Conference on 6/21/22 at 10:15 a.m. Next court date given to Mr. Hughes in court.
No contact with S.M. (1977) with the exception of telephonic contact to discuss settling personal affairs regarding property.
No contact with S.M. (1977) with the exception of telephonic contact to discuss settling personal affairs regarding property.

3:38 pm Defendant Joel D Hughes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Joel D Hughes.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Sergeant Adam Ross, sworn in and testified.  State requests court take judicial notice of bond in case 21CF399.  Court takes judicial notice.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over.  State efiles information.  Arraignment to be set with other cases.  Motion to modify bond.  Arguments made by parties.  No objection to telephonic contact with victim while defendant remains in jail to settle some personal affairs.  Court sets bond at $1,000 Cash and $2,000 Signature with conditions: No contact with S.M. (1977) with the exception of telephonic contact to discuss settling personal affairs regarding property. Bond forms.
Arraignment scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Svehlek received complaint.  Attorney Svehlek requests bond modification. Court denies motion to modify bond. Parities to schedule for further proceedings with the judicial assistant.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes finding of probable cause. Court sets $3000.00 cash bond. Conditions, no contact with S.M. dob 1977. Court sets initial appearance to April 8th at 1:30 pm.
